intro: Rutidea brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in racemes, and can be found in a range of colors from white to purple. Rutidea brachyantha is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
